channel.title: Compile error, I've never seen this before
channel.description:
Problem: Error compiling Server Base: Project 16 and another server I've tried that MIGHT be Project 16 based. Difficulty: Unknown Details: I've compiled servers on other computers, and it works perfectly. Ive tried two compile codes, the default has the error I don't understand, and the other doesn't compile it. I have downloaded JDK 6.0, does it have anything to do with that? Here is what it says:
break; ^ client.java:4062: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4067: class, interface, or enum expected public int teleReq = 0; ^ client.java:4068: class, interface, or enum expected public String teleLoc = ""; ^ client.java:4069: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean teleOtherScreen = false; ^ client.java:4071: class, interface, or enum expected public void teleOtherRequest(String teleLocation, int player) { ^ client.java:4075: class, interface, or enum expected sendQuest(telePlayer, 12558); ^ client.java:4076: class, interface, or enum expected sendQuest(teleLocation, 12560); ^ client.java:4077: class, interface, or enum expected showInterface(12468); ^ client.java:4079: class, interface, or enum expected teleReq = player; ^ client.java:4080: class, interface, or enum expected teleLoc = teleLocation; ^ client.java:4082: class, interface, or enum expected teleOtherScreen = true; ^ client.java:4084: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4087: class, interface, or enum expected public int hasset = 0; ^ client.java:4088: class, interface, or enum expected public int oldclick = 0; ^ client.java:4089: class, interface, or enum expected public int sameclick = 0; ^ client.java:4091: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean HasArrows = false; ^ client.java:4092: class, interface, or enum expected public void DeleteArrow() ^ client.java:4097: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4100: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(1688); ^ client.java:4101: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(playerArrows); ^ client.java:4102: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(playerEquipment[playerArrows]+1); ^ client.java:4103: class, interface, or enum expected if (playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] -1 > 254) { ^ client.java:4105: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeDWord(playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] -1); ^ client.java:4106: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4109: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4111: class, interface, or enum expected playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] -= 1; ^ client.java:4112: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4114: class, interface, or enum expected appearanceUpdateRequired = true; ^ client.java:4115: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4116: class, interface, or enum expected public void CheckArrows() ^ client.java:4118: class, interface, or enum expected for(int k = 880; k < 893; k++){ ^ client.java:4118: class, interface, or enum expected for(int k = 880; k < 893; k++){ ^ client.java:4122: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4125: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4128: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4133: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean wearing = false; ^ client.java:4136: class, interface, or enum expected public int WildyLevel = 0; ^ client.java:4137: class, interface, or enum expected public int leftwild = 0; ^ client.java:4138: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean InWildrange = false; ^ client.java:4139: class, interface, or enum expected public void WriteWildyLevel() ^ client.java:4142: class, interface, or enum expected int oldlevel = WildyLevel; ^ client.java:4143: class, interface, or enum expected WildyLevel = (((absY - 3520) / 8) + 1); ^ client.java:4144: class, interface, or enum expected if(inwildy2 && WildyLevel != oldlevel) ^ client.java:4147: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197); ^ client.java:4148: class, interface, or enum expected sendQuest("Level: "+WildyLevel, 199); ^ client.java:4149: class, interface, or enum expected leftwild = 1; ^ client.java:4150: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4154: class, interface, or enum expected leftwild = 0; ^ client.java:4155: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4157: class, interface, or enum expected public void CheckWildrange(int pcombat) ^ client.java:4162: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4166: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4171: class, interface, or enum expected public void frame60(int i1, int i2, int i3) ^ client.java:4174: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(i1); ^ client.java:4175: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByteC(i2); ^ client.java:4176: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(i3); ^ client.java:4177: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4178: class, interface, or enum expected public void frame60rename(int cameraX, int cameraY, int jFrame) ^ client.java:4181: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(cameraX); ^ client.java:4182: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByteC(cameraY); ^ client.java:4183: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(jFrame); ^ client.java:4184: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4185: class, interface, or enum expected public void frame8(int i1, int i2) // worked out what it does, but it doesn't se em to do anything wtfz XD ^ client.java:4188: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWordBigEndianA(i1); // interface ^ client.java:4189: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(i2); // weapon id being drawn ^ client.java:4190: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4191: class, interface, or enum expected public void frame64(int i1, int i2) // tested, found nothing, apparently somethi ng to do with dropped items ^ client.java:4194: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByteS(i1); ^ client.java:4195: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByteA(i2); ^ client.java:4196: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4197: class, interface, or enum expected public void frame72(int i1) // logs you out :S ^ client.java:4200: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWordBigEndian(i1); ^ client.java:4201: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4202: class, interface, or enum expected public void frame74(int i1) // MUSIC! ^ client.java:4205: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWordBigEndian(i1); ^ client.java:4206: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4207: class, interface, or enum expected public void frame121(int i1, int i2) // MUSIC! this one used alot less often tho ugh :D ^ client.java:4210: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(i1); ^ client.java:4211: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByteS(i2); ^ client.java:4212: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4213: class, interface, or enum expected public void frame122(int i1, int i2) // colour changing on interface :O! ^ client.java:4216: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWordBigEndianA(i1); // interface ^ client.java:4217: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWordBigEndianA(i2); // colour stuff ^ client.java:4218: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4219: class, interface, or enum expected public void frame166(int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4, int i5) // CAMERA STUFF!!!! ! 0 on all makes it lock on that place, make last over 100 to make it go black!! - xerozcheez ^ client.java:4222: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(i1); // X coord where camera will end within the region ^ client.java:4223: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(i2); // Y coord where camera will end within the region ^ client.java:4224: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(i3); // the camera height where it will end ^ client.java:4225: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(i4); // the camera moving speed ^ client.java:4226: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(i5); // if this goes above 100 it does something? :O ^ client.java:4227: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4230: class, interface, or enum expected public void frame177(int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4, int i5) // similar to 166, a good combo: f177 041 033 014 011 005 - xerozcheez ^ client.java:4233: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(i1); // X coord within the region middle of your screen will view to ^ client.java:4234: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(i2); // Y coord within the region middle of your screen will view to ^ client.java:4235: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(i3); // the height it will be viewing to ^ client.java:4236: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(i4); // the camera speed? movement? dunno yet ^ 100 errors Press any key to continue . . .
As you can see, something is wrong. That was when i put in
@echo off title Compiler "%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause
... and when i try to put in this one,
@echo off title Runserver set java="C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\java.exe" java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server pause
It doesn't compile. There are no errors, but it just doesn't compile. I'm at a complete loss. Anyone want to help me?

item.title: Compile error, I've never seen this before
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

you have errors in your source buddy…
fix them, the compiler says whay errors you have, and re compile

PS
the compiler hasn’t errors, the SOURCE has errors!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Compile error, I've never seen this before
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Then how come the server isnt running?
It wont let me connect to the server
it usually says

Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Starting Testscape on (etc etc etc.)
instead of
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

What? No, this same thing has happened with two sources. I will try with one more, maybe theyre anti-leech and I’ve never noticed.

Hm.
Ill try it with a different source.[br][size=1]Posted at: December 16, 2006, 09:12:15 PM[/size][hr]Okay, now I’ve tried it with a different source and with

@echo off
title Compiler
“%ProgramFiles%Javajdk1.6.0injavac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause
And it says
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Compile error, I've never seen this before
item.dc:creator: @Billys_Java Billys Java
item.description:
@Billys_Java wrote:

that is mod taharoks i believe and it should work no matter what so yeah

[quote=“Mrquarter, post:2, topic:36174”]Just put in your compiler

:: ::
:: All of the following code is © Copywrited 2006-2007, ::
:: Grene Penguin Entertainment. ::
:: ::
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

@echo off
cls
:menu
title Runserver + Compiler version 1.1
echo Please choose an option below to do that function.
echo Keep posted on the Moparscape Tutorials section for
echo any updates that I post.
echo.
echo c - Compile your server.
echo r - To run your server.
echo e - To exit out of the program.
echo.
echo.
set /p compile=Option:
if %compile%==c goto compile
if %compile%==C goto compile
if %compile%==r goto run
if %compile%==R goto run
if %compile%==e goto end
if %compile%==E goto end
if %compile#==* goto error
goto error
:compile
cls
title Compiler
if defined javac (goto compile2) else (goto checkjavac)
:compile2
if exist *.java (goto compile3) else (goto compileerror)
:compile3
%javac% -cp . *.java
pause
cls
goto menu
:compileerror
cls
echo You need to have Java files for this compiler to compile.
pause
cls
goto menu
:run
cls
title Runserver
if exist .\server.class (goto run2) else (goto servererror)
:run2
set java=java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar
cls
goto run3
:run3
%java% server
pause
cls
goto menu
:servererror
cls
title Error
echo You do not have a Server.class. Make sure that you have used the
echo compiler with your server BEFORE you try running it.
pause
cls
goto menu
:error
cls
title Error
echo Invalid command. Please make sure the commands you type
echo in are correct.
pause
cls
goto menu
:end
cls
exit
:checkjavac
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac) else (goto checkjavac2)
:checkjavac2
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac2) else (goto checkjavac3)
:checkjavac3
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_08\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac3) else (goto checkjavac4)
:checkjavac4
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac4) else (goto checkjavac5)
:checkjavac5
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_10\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac5) else (goto checkjavac6)
:checkjavac6
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac6) else (goto javacerror)
:setjavac
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac2
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac3
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_08\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac4
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac5
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_10\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
:javacerror
cls
title Error
echo You do not have JDK 5.0 Update 6-10 or JDK 6.0. Go to Mod Taharok’s tutorial
echo on the Moparscape Tuturoials section for a direct link to download
echo the newest JDK 5.0 Update.
pause
cls
goto menu[/code][/quote]

Read full topic

Just put in your compiler

:: ::

::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

@echo off
cls

echo e - To exit out of the program.
echo.
echo.
set /p compile=Option:
if %compile%==c goto compile
if %compile%==C goto compile
if %compile%==r goto run
if %compile%==R goto run
if %compile%==e goto end
if %compile%==E goto end
if %compile#==* goto error
goto error
:compile
cls
title Compiler
if defined javac (goto compile2) else (goto checkjavac)
:compile2
if exist *.java (goto compile3) else (goto compileerror)
:compile3
%javac% -cp . *.java
pause
cls
goto menu
:compileerror
cls
echo You need to have Java files for this compiler to compile.
pause
cls
goto menu
:run
cls
title Runserver
if exist .\server.class (goto run2) else (goto servererror)
:run2
set java=java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar

goto run3

%java% server
pause
cls

echo compiler with your server BEFORE you try running it.

echo in are correct.
pause
cls
goto menu
:end
cls
exit
:checkjavac
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac) else (goto checkjavac2)
:checkjavac2
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac2) else (goto checkjavac3)

if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_08\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac3) else (goto checkjavac4)
:checkjavac4
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac4) else (goto checkjavac5)
:checkjavac5
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_10\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac5) else (goto checkjavac6)
:checkjavac6
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac6) else (goto javacerror)
:setjavac
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac2
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac3
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_08\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac4

goto compile2

item.title: Compile error, I've never seen this before
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Problem: Error compiling
Server Base: Project 16 and another server I’ve tried that MIGHT be Project 16 based.
Difficulty: Unknown

Details: I’ve compiled servers on other computers, and it works perfectly. Ive tried two compile codes, the default has the error I don’t understand, and the other doesn’t compile it. I have downloaded JDK 6.0, does it have anything to do with that? Here is what it says:

break; ^ client.java:4062: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4067: class, interface, or enum expected public int teleReq = 0; ^ client.java:4068: class, interface, or enum expected public String teleLoc = ""; ^ client.java:4069: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean teleOtherScreen = false; ^ client.java:4071: class, interface, or enum expected public void teleOtherRequest(String teleLocation, int player) { ^ client.java:4075: class, interface, or enum expected sendQuest(telePlayer, 12558); ^ client.java:4076: class, interface, or enum expected sendQuest(teleLocation, 12560); ^ client.java:4077: class, interface, or enum expected showInterface(12468); ^ client.java:4079: class, interface, or enum expected teleReq = player; ^ client.java:4080: class, interface, or enum expected teleLoc = teleLocation; ^ client.java:4082: class, interface, or enum expected teleOtherScreen = true; ^ client.java:4084: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4087: class, interface, or enum expected public int hasset = 0; ^ client.java:4088: class, interface, or enum expected public int oldclick = 0; ^ client.java:4089: class, interface, or enum expected public int sameclick = 0; ^ client.java:4091: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean HasArrows = false; ^ client.java:4092: class, interface, or enum expected public void DeleteArrow() ^ client.java:4097: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4100: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(1688); ^ client.java:4101: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(playerArrows); ^ client.java:4102: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(playerEquipment[playerArrows]+1); ^ client.java:4103: class, interface, or enum expected if (playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] -1 > 254) { ^ client.java:4105: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeDWord(playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] -1); ^ client.java:4106: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4109: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4111: class, interface, or enum expected playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] -= 1; ^ client.java:4112: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4114: class, interface, or enum expected appearanceUpdateRequired = true; ^ client.java:4115: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4116: class, interface, or enum expected public void CheckArrows() ^ client.java:4118: class, interface, or enum expected for(int k = 880; k < 893; k++){ ^ client.java:4118: class, interface, or enum expected for(int k = 880; k < 893; k++){ ^ client.java:4122: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4125: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4128: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:4133: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean wearing = false; ^ client.java:4136: class, interface, or enum expected public int WildyLevel = 0; ^ client.java:4137: class, interface, or enum expected public int leftwild = 0; ^ client.java:4138: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean InWildrange = false; ^ client.java:4139: class, interface, or enum expected public void WriteWildyLevel() ^ client.java:4142: class, interface, or enum expected int oldlevel = WildyLevel; ^ client.java:4143: class, interface, or enum expected WildyLevel = (((absY - 3520) / 8) + 1); ^ client.java:4144: class, interface, or enum expected if(inwildy2 && WildyLevel != oldlevel) ^ client.java:4147: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197); ^ client.java:4148: class, interface, or enum expected sendQuest("Level: "+WildyLevel, 199); // the height it will be viewing to ^ client.java:4236: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(i4); // the camera speed? movement? dunno yet ^ 100 errors Press any key to continue . . .

As you can see, something is wrong. That was when i put in

@echo off
title Compiler
“%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause
…

and when i try to put in this one,

@echo off
title Runserver
set java=“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\java.exe”
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
pause

It doesn’t compile. There are no errors, but it just doesn’t compile. I’m at a complete loss. Anyone want to help me?

Read full topic
item.source: Compile error, I've never seen this before
